intro: Argostemma africanum, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, night-blooming white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical gardens.
